meanings.definition: To be thrown or tossed violently.
meanings.sent1: The strong wind rolfed the leaves across the yard.
meanings.sent2: She rolfed the ball to her friend during the game.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy rolfed the toy around the room.
meanings.sent4: The storm rolfed the boat on the rough waves.
meanings.sent5: The angry teacher rolfed the paper off the desk in frustration.

meanings.definition: To be defeated or overwhelmed easily.
meanings.sent1: The team was rolfed by their opponents in the match.
meanings.sent2: He felt rolfed after failing the test.
meanings.sent3: The little ant rolfed the giant in the race.
meanings.sent4: The loud music rolfed his concentration during the exam.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected news rolfed her emotions into chaos.

meanings.definition: To be consumed or devoured quickly.
meanings.sent1: The hungry child rolfed the cookies in seconds.
meanings.sent2: The wolves rolfed down the prey in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The vacuum cleaner rolfed up all the dirt on the floor.
meanings.sent4: The fire rolfed through the dry grass in the field.
meanings.sent5: The crowd rolfed the snacks at the party before the main course was served.
